channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One Sentence in the Constitution Is Causing America Huge Problems
item.description: An amendment that can help save our democracy.

item.title: Israel will call up 60,000 reservists. And, N.C. braces for effects of Hurricane Erin
item.description: Israel plans to call up 60,000 reservists for its new Gaza City offensive. And, North Carolina's Outer Banks is bracing for the flood and damage that ...

item.title: What to know about the Menendez brothers' case as their parole hearings begin
item.description: Erik and Lyle Menendez will get their first-ever parole hearings on Thursday and Friday, after spending more than three decades in prison for their pa...

item.title: The kids missing the most amount of school may surprise you: kindergartners
item.description: A California school district fights chronic absenteeism in kindergarten by helping parents decide whether their kid is too sick to go to school.

item.title: When the C.E.O. Retires but Won’t Go Away
item.description: Target is the latest company to keep a replaced chief executive around as an “executive chairman.” Does having two top dogs make sense?

item.title: Israel has approved a settlement project that could divide the West Bank
item.description: Israel gave final approval for a settlement project in the occupied West Bank that would effectively cut the territory in two, which Palestinians say ...

item.title: What to Know About Corruption Investigations Surrounding Eric Adams
item.description: Months after a federal corruption indictment against Mayor Eric Adams of New York was dropped, some of his allies remain under investigation or have b...

item.title: Walmart’s Earnings Show ‘Momentum’ as Tariffs Raise Prices
item.description: After mixed reports from retail rivals, Walmart reported better-than-expected quarterly results and raised its sales forecast for the year.

item.title: Why Shop? In Maine, the Library of Things Has It All (Almost).
item.description: One town’s effort to make pricey items accessible and encourage people to buy less stuff seems to be catching on.

item.title: A Russian airstrike hits a U.S. factory in western Ukraine
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says a Russian cruise missile hit a U.S. electronics plant in the far west of Ukraine. The strike was part of an overnig...

item.title: Why India Is Stuck on Russian Oil
item.description: Three years ago, India ramped up its imports of Russia’s oil. Now President Trump is demanding that India reverse course and quit its cheap Russian oi...

item.title: Dusky Gopher Frogs Are Making a Comeback in Mississippi
item.description: Fewer than 100 dusky gopher frogs were known to remain. Thanks to some very dedicated humans, numbers are now on the rise.

item.title: Why Shop? In Maine, the Library of Things Has It All (Almost).
item.description: One town’s effort to make pricey items accessible and encourage people to buy less stuff seems to be catching on.

item.title: A Miles-Long Cave in Kentucky Was a Smelly Disaster. Now It’s Spectacular.
item.description: Hidden River Cave was once filled with heavy metals and sewage that made the surrounding town smell awful. After a cleanup, it became a tourist draw.

item.title: French Authorities Investigate Death of Streamer Jean Pormanove After Months of Abuse
item.description: Raphaël Graven, known online as Jean Pormanove, was regularly subjected to humiliation and abuse on Kick, a streaming platform.
